revised_title: Influence of Host Factors on Symbiotic Infection and Nodule Development in Leguminous Plants
tldr: This article discusses the influence of host factors on the symbiotic relationship between leguminous plants and root-nodule bacteria. The author explores how genetic factors in the host plant affect infection, nodule development, and nitrogen fixation. The study highlights the complex interactions between plant and bacterial factors and their impact on the symbiotic process.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Plant Biology
